isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - LOWER COUNTERSHAFT BEARING

step1.para: Place a countershaft support under the lower countershaft in the front case bore ( Figure 134).

figure.caption: Figure 134. Place Countershaft Support Under Lower Countershaft

step1.para: Place a large screwdriver or prybar at the front of the countershaft between the case wall and countershaft to space the countershaft rearward approximately 6 mm (1/4 inch) ( Figure 135).
Place the bearing over the rear of the countershaft. It doesn't matter which bearing you choose. The front and rear bearings are identical.

caution.para: To install the bearing in step 4, the bearing driver must bear on both the inner and outer race of the bearing. If the bearing driver contacts only one race, the bearing will be damaged.

step1.para: Place a flanged-end bearing driver over the bearing, and drive the bearing over the countershaft and into the case bore. When the bearing is fully seated, no gap should be visible between the bearing and the shaft. If the bearing is not fully seated, the snap ring to be installed at Step 6 will not fit ( Figure 136).

figure.caption: Figure 136. Drive Bearing Over Countershaft into Case Bore

step1.para: If used, install the oil pump drive gear.
In the countershaft rear groove, install the rear snap ring ( Figure 137).
If necessary, tap the countershaft forward to seat the rear bearing snap ring in its bore.
Temporarily install the mainshaft rear bearing retainer using two or more bolts. The cover prevents the countershaft from moving rearward when the front bearing is installed.
Remove the countershaft support tool and place the front bearing on the front of the countershaft.
Place a flanged-end bearing driver over the bearing, and drive the bearing until the inner race is flush with the front of the countershaft.
Remove the mainshaft rear bearing retainer.
